### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17566](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17566.html) (Switch to weight units for all feerates com

No it's simply a reporting issue.

On Sun, Dec 1, 2019, 4:51 PM practicalswift <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @instagibbs <https://github.com/instagibbs>
>
> Thanks for tackling this quickly.
>
> I'm not too familiar with this part of the code: is there any scenario
> where the wrong fee could have been selected due to the uninitialized read?
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this becau

A demo of the unitialized read (prior to the fix):

```
$ test/functional/uninitialized_orig_fee.py -l WARNING
origfee: 1401472.87914520
$ test/functional/uninitialized_orig_fee.py -l WARNING
origfee: 1400508.05266608
$ test/functional/uninitialized_orig_fee.py -l WARNING
origfee: 1404964.24912920
$ test/functional/uninitialized_orig_fee.py -l WARNING
origfee: 1E-8
$ test/fun

With the patch in this PR applied:

```
$ test/functional/uninitialized_orig_fee.py -l WARNING
origfee: 0.00000141
$ test/functional/uninitialized_orig_fee.py -l WARNING
origfee: 0.00000141
$ test/functional/uninitialized_orig_fee.py -l WARNING
origfee: 0.00000141
$ test/functional/uninitialized_orig_fee.py -l WARNING
origfee: 0.00000141
$ test/functional/uninitialized_orig_f
ACK. Tested by running the test without re-compiling bitcoind
done, and re-ordered the arguments to be all const then non-const.
